moves.1. d4 d5: My first tournement game opens with Queen pawn
moves.5. Nf3 Nge7 6. Nc3 Ng6 7. d5 exd5 8. Nxd: is this risky? Unconventional for the openings i have studied so far.
moves.8... Be7 9. Bb5 Bd7 10. O-O O-O 11. b3 a: After being checked, my stratagy for mates comes into play.
moves.14... Bxd4 15. c3 Ba7 16. e5: I sacrafice the pawn to the knight to open up the h7 pawn
moves.19. Qxe5: I take the knight, compensating for the lost bishop (hence only pawn was sacraficed and I now have extensive pressure on the kings position.
moves.19... Re8: Threatens queen, white moves queen, Black bishop threatens white knight, forgetting the now  unprotected f7 pawn
moves.21... Kh8: I had actually not thought this far aheard, I was trying to maintain check to save my knight, or perhaps, move the black king onto g7, so i could sacrafice my knight and open up the g file for a queen/rook mate.
moves.22. Nxc7: The game finishes here, black either loses the queen, or loses a rook. Already being 2 points behind, resigns.
